Breaking News: Moderna is asking the FDA to authorize its coronavirus vaccine for emergency use. It could possibly begin reaching Americans by Dec. 21.
nytimes.com
Moderna Applies for Emergency F.D.A. Approval for Its Coronavirus Vaccine
The first shots could be given as early as Dec. 21, if authorization is granted.

473
1.3K

Moderna’s stock has more than doubled this month, and surged 15% on Monday, after the company said it would apply for emergency FDA approval for its coronavirus vaccine. The first shots could be given as early as Dec. 21, if authorization is granted.
nytimes.com
Moderna’s share price has more than doubled this month as its vaccine advanced toward approval.

Moderna, which says its vaccine is 94.1% effective in adults, will soon begin testing it in children ages 12 through 17. Vaccines meant for both adults and children are generally tested first in adults to help make sure they are safe for pediatric trials.
nytimes.com
Moderna Plans to Begin Testing Its Coronavirus Vaccine in Children
The company said the trial would involve children ages 12 through 17.

The FDA found that the Moderna coronavirus vaccine is highly protective for adults and prevents severe cases of Covid-19. The agency is likely to grant emergency authorization for a second coronavirus vaccine this week for millions of Americans.

Moderna Vaccine Is Highly Protective Against Covid-19, the F.D.A. Finds
The positive review most likely ensures that the Food and Drug Administration will grant emergency authorization to a second coronavirus vaccine this week for millions of Americans.
